isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 11 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTO-1X707LL/DLL/MLL AND RTO-1X709MLL MODELS - ASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT ASSEMBLY (1X709 MODELS)

note.para: Each mainshaft gear that has an I.D. snap ring must have its I.D. snap ring installed before placement on the mainshaft. Do not reverse gear I.D. snap ring.

Gear limit washers are internally splined and locked to the mainshaft by the key. Gear spacers are externally splined to engage with the gear hub clutching teeth. There is one limit washer and one spacer for each mainshaft gear.
Axial clearance (end-play) limits are .006" to .015" (0.15 to 0.4 mm) for all mainshaft gears.

If the axial clearance is less than the minimum .006" tolerance, the limit washer should be replaced with a thinner limit washer. This will increase the axial clearance between the gears. If the axial clearance is greater than the maximum .015" tolerance, a thicker limit washer should be installed. This will decrease the axial clearance between the gears.

step1.para: With mainshaft pilot-end down, secure the mainshaft in a vise equipped with brass jaws or wood blocks ( Figure 164).
If previously removed, install the roll pin in keyway ( Figure 164).
Position the 4th speed gear washer in the mainshaft 1st or bottom groove with washer flat side up. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 165).

Start at the mainshaft bottom and install a plastic air line in the keyway to lock the washer in place. As limit washers and gears are installed, continue to push the plastic air line up ( Figure 165).
Position the 4th speed gear on the mainshaft with clutching teeth down ( Figure 166).
Install the flat washer ( Figure 166).
Install the 3rd speed gear with clutching teeth up and against the flat washer ( Figure 167)
Position the washer against the spacer with the washer flat side down. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 168).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 168).
Install the 2nd-3rd speed sliding clutch with the missing internal splines aligned with the plastic line ( Figure 169).
With the washer flat side up, position the 2nd speed gear limit washer in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 170).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 170).
Install 2nd gear spacer ( Figure 170).
With clutching teeth down, position the 2nd speed gear on the mainshaft engaging with spacer external splines ( Figure 171).
With clutching teeth up, install 1st speed gear on the shaft against 2nd speed gear ( Figure 172).
Position 1st speed gear spacer against 1st speed gear, engaging with spacer external splines with gear clutching teeth ( Figure 173).
Position the limit washer against the spacer with the washer flat side down. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 173).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 173).
Insert a .003" feeler gauge and a .007" feeler gauge between the gear hub and mainshaft spacer ( Figure 174). If out of tolerance, change the limit against the mainshaft spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 174. Check Tolerance With Feeler Gauge

step1.para: Align the sliding clutch missing internal spline with the mainshaft key and install the 1st-reverse speed sliding clutch ( Figure 175).
With the flat side up, position the reverse speed gear limit washer (white) in the next available groove. Rotate the washer until the washer splines and mainshaft splines align ( Figure 175).
Push the air line up to lock the washer on mainshaft ( Figure 175).
Position the reverse speed gear spacer against the limit washer ( Figure 175).
Install reverse gear on the mainshaft. Engage the gear clutching teeth with spacer external splines and sliding clutch. Move the reverse gear down against the 1st speed gear ( Figure 176).

figure.caption: Figure 176. Reverse Gear Against 1st Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the air line and insert the mainshaft key ( Figure 177).

note.para: Be careful not to move the gears while doing this procedure. The limit washers are unlocked and can rotate which would cause the gears to drop.

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft from the vise ( Figure 178).

figure.caption: Figure 178. Engage Splines With 4th Speed Gear Clutching Teeth

step1.para: On the shaft front, align the sliding clutch missing internal spline with the mainshaft key and install the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch. Engage the sliding clutch external splines with the 4th speed gear clutching teeth ( Figure 178).

note.para: Make sure reverse gear is against 1st speed gear, the mainshaft key is in the keyway, and the 4th-Drive gear sliding clutch is engaged into 4th speed gear.
